title: I decided to pay off a school’s lunch debt
summary: The text discusses a debate on Hacker News about whether schools should pay off their lunch debt or not. The original question asked if the overhead in deciding who gets free lunch and who doesn't, and then managing the debt, was saving more money than just giving all public school kids free lunches with no strings attached. The discussion then veered off into other topics, such as transit fares and the fair structure of payment systems. Some participants argued that the cost of upgrading payment systems was not worth it, while others believed it was necessary to improve the efficiency of the system. The text also touches on the issue of means testing and how it can be inefficient and costly. Overall, the text highlights the complexities and trade-offs involved in making decisions about public spending and the allocation of resources.
